company. At 1700 each mainday the Registry closed and she would go away until
the next sign-in, at mainday 0800.
Day after day. She went out to interviews and sometimes she took a temp job and
Mainday noon she got her cred-chit from Ely and she went to a sit-down
Past 1900 now, past 2000 hours. She paced and she studied the calluses on her

"You got a job. You get your supplies from ten-two, you get on it, get it done.
Up to the galley by noon, for tea and a Keis-roll, the hard way, quiet there,
Past 2000 hours a/d, and people walked by, crew evidently on errands, occasional
side. Maybe she could get finished before midnight. Maybe get that cup of tea.
"You can get skinned in this company," she complained, figuring up it was two
faster, hit that much harder, grip that much tighter. It's incremental. At 150,
